subject: Cybersecurity
title: Elliptic Curve Cryptography: Smaller Keys, Same Strength
description: One-minute skill: Elliptic Curve Cryptography: Smaller Keys, Same Strength.

hook.text: A 256-bit elliptic curve key provides the same security as a 3,072-bit RSA key. Smaller, faster, stronger.

buildup.text: ECC uses the math of points on elliptic curves instead of prime factoring. The math is harder to reverse.

discovery.text: This means ECC needs much shorter keys for equivalent security, making it ideal for mobile and IoT devices.

twist.text: The NSA endorsed ECC in 2005, then mysteriously backed away in 2015, fueling speculation about hidden weaknesses.

climax.text: Despite the controversy, ECC powers Bitcoin, Signal, and most modern TLS connections.

punchline.text: Curves solved what primes couldn't: security that fits in your pocket.

quiz.question: What advantage does ECC have over RSA?
options: It provides equivalent security with much shorter keys
